Study: Plasma albumin levels predict risk for nonsurvivors in critically ill patients with COVID-19
Study Population: Central Hospital of Wuhan from 1 January to 20 February 2020

Study: Interim Analysis of Risk Factors for Severe Outcomes among a Cohort of Hospitalized Adults Identified through the U.S. Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19)-Associated Hospitalization Surveillance Network (COVID-NET)
Multivariate adjustment: age, sex, race/ethnicity, smoker, hypertension, obesity, diabetes, chronic lung disease, cardiovascular disease, neurologic disease, renal disease, immunosuppression, hematologic disorders, and rheumatologic or autoimmune disease
Study Population: 120 counties located in 14 states 113 (California, Colorado, Connecticut, Georgia, Iowa, Maryland, Michigan, Minnesota, New Mexico, New 114 York, Ohio, Oregon, Tennessee, and Utah)

Study: Interim Analysis of Risk Factors for Severe Outcomes among a Cohort of Hospitalized Adults Identified through the U.S. Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19)-Associated Hospitalization Surveillance Network (COVID-NET)
Study Population: 119 counties located in 14 states 113 (California, Colorado, Connecticut, Georgia, Iowa, Maryland, Michigan, Minnesota, New Mexico, New 114 York, Ohio, Oregon, Tennessee, and Utah)

Study: OpenSAFELY: factors associated with COVID-19-related hospital death in the linked electronic health records of 17 million adult NHS patients.
Multivariate adjustment: age, gender, obesity, smoking status, diabetes, cancer, hematological malignancy, asthma, chronic respiratory disease, heart disease, hypertension, chronic liver disease, stroke or dementia, other neurological disease, reduced kidney function, organ transplant, spleen disease, rheumatoid arthritis/lupus/psoriasis, immunosuppression
Study Population: TPP general practice in England from February 1 to April 25, 2020.

Study: Well-aerated Lung on Admitting Chest CT to Predict Adverse Outcome in COVID-19 Pneumonia.
Study Population: Italy, Emergency department admissions with CT results

Study: Preliminary Estimates of the Prevalence of Selected Underlying Health Conditions Among Patients with Coronavirus Disease 2019 — United States, February 12–March 28, 2020 [MMWR Morb Mortal Wkly Rep]
Study Population: CDC passive surveillance registry as of March 28, 2026

Study: Risk Factors Associated with Clinical Outcomes in 323 COVID-19 Patients in Wuhan, China
Study Population: Tianyou Hospital from January 8 to February 20, 2020
